children.text: The shrinkage cuts installed into the concrete paving are not deep enough, which will likely contribute to cracking.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3727 Guide to Residential Pavement requires these cuts to be between 1/4 to 1/3 the depth of the concrete.
Given that this driveway paving should be a minimum of 100mm thick these cuts need to be between 25 and 33mm deep.
